support_summary: The chaperone Hsc70 (HSPA8) recognizes a KFERQ-like motif in TDP-43, targeting it for degradation via the chaperone-mediated autophagy (CMA) pathway. This interaction is crucial for maintaining TDP-43 homeostasis, and its disruption can lead to the accumulation of toxic TDP-43 species.

functions.cellular_process: TDP-43 is a substrate for chaperone-mediated autophagy (CMA), a selective form of autophagy. The chaperone Hsc70 recognizes a KFERQ-like motif within TDP-43, targeting it to the lysosomal membrane receptor LAMP2A for translocation and degradation within the lysosome.
functions.effect_description: Hsc70-mediated recognition of TDP-43 initiates its clearance through the CMA pathway, thereby preventing its accumulation and potential aggregation.
biological_consequence: Hsc70 recognizes KFERQ-like motif in soluble TDP-43 → Hsc70-TDP-43 complex binds to LAMP2A receptor on lysosome → TDP-43 is translocated into the lysosome → Lysosomal degradation of TDP-43 → Maintenance of TDP-43 homeostasis

Reduced Hsc70 expression or CMA dysfunction → Impaired recognition of TDP-43 → Failure to target TDP-43 to the lysosome → Cytoplasmic accumulation of TDP-43 → Formation of toxic aggregates → Neurodegeneration
Pathological TDP-43 aggregation → Upregulation of Hsc70 and LAMP2A expression (CMA stress response) → Overload of the CMA pathway → Lysosomal membrane permeabilization → Cellular toxicity
specific_effects: Both wild-type and an aggregate-prone form of TDP-43 are CMA substrates. [9, 10]
The aggregate-prone form of TDP-43 interacts with Hsc70 and can up-regulate the expression of CMA components, leading to increased CMA activity. [9, 10]
Reduced Hsc70 expression is observed in lymphomonocytes of sporadic ALS patients and is associated with increased insoluble TDP-43. [40]
Experimental silencing of Hsc70 leads to an increase in TDP-43 protein levels in human neuroblastoma cells. [40]

summary: TDP43 activates Hsc70 to modulate tdp-43 degradation (chaperone-mediated autophagy), ultimately affecting maintenance of tdp-43 homeostasis.
